title: Making a Conclusion for a Test on Regression
question_text:
A statistics student wants to know if the grade a student earns on the statistics final exam can be predicted from the grade they earn on the statistics midterm exam. Below is a computer output for linear regression of final exam scores versus midterm exam scores from a sample of $40$ randomly chosen students at the school.
PredictorCoefSE Coef$T$$P$
Constant$406.9$$164.8$$2.47$$0.020$
Midterm$58.45$$24.77$$2.36$$0.026$
The student will test the hypotheses Ho: $\beta = 0$ vs Ha: $\beta > 0$. Assuming conditions for inference have been checked and met, which is the following is the appropriate conclusion to make, using an $\alpha$ level of $0.05$?

choices.text:
Since the
P
-value of
0.020
is less than
α
, we reject Ho. There is convincing evidence of a linear relationship between final exam scores and midterm scores for the students at this school.

Since the
P
-value of
0.020
is greater than
α
, we fail to reject Ho. We do not have enough evidence to conclude that there is a linear relationship between final exam scores and midterm scores for the students at this school.

Since the
P
-value of
0.026
is greater than
α
, we accept Ho. We have convincing evidence that there is not a linear relationship between final exam scores and midterm scores for the students at this school.

Since the
P
-value of
0.026
is less than
α
, we accept Ho. We have convincing evidence that there is not a linear relationship between final exam scores and midterm scores for the students at this school.

Since the
P
-value of
0.026
is less than
α
, we reject Ho. There is convincing evidence of a linear relationship between final exam scores and midterm scores for the students at this school.
